IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ARIZONA SPORTS FOUNDATION IS COMMITTED TO FOSTERING A CULTURE INVOLVEMENT AND GIVING.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THROUGH THE ANNUAL FIESTA BOWL AND RELATED EVENTS, WE STRIVE TO CREATE A POSITIVE ECONOMIC IMPACT FOR ARIZONA AND FOCUS ON THE COMMUNITY WHILE HAVING FUN.
IRS990.Desc: THE ARIZONA SPORTS FOUNDATION ANNUALLY STAGES THE FIESTA BOWL, WHICH IS PART OF THE COLLEGE FOOTBALL PLAYOFF (CFP) SYSTEM. THE GAME IS PLAYED IN UNIVERSITY OF PHOENIX STADIUM IN GLENDALE, ARIZONA. THE 45TH ANNUAL FIESTA BOWL WAS PLAYED ON JANUARY 1, 2016, IN FRONT OF A CROWD OF 71,123 . THE OHIO STATE BUCKEYES DEFEATED NOTRE DAME FIGHTING IRISH 44-28.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION FOLLOWS THE ACCOUNTING STANDARD FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THE FOUNDATION RECOGNIZED NO LIABILITY FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AS OF MARCH 31, 2016.

THE ORGANIZATION HAS A FORMAL BONUS PLAN BASED UPON ORGANIZATIONAL AND INDIVIDUAL GOALS. THESE GOALS MAY INCLUDE RESULTS CONTINGENT ON REVENUE OR NET INCOME OF THE ARIZONA SPORTS FOUNDATION AND RELATED ORGANIZATIONS. BONUSES ARE APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO PAYMENT.

THE ORGANIZATION HAS A FORMAL BONUS PLAN BASED UPON ORGANIZATIONAL AND INDIVIDUAL GOALS. THESE GOALS MAY INCLUDE RESULTS CONTINGENT ON REVENUE OR NET INCOME OF THE ARIZONA SPORTS FOUNDATION AND RELATED ORGANIZATIONS. BONUSES ARE APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO PAYMENT.

THE ORGANIZATION HAS A FORMAL BONUS PLAN BASED UPON ORGANIZATIONAL AND INDIVIDUAL GOALS. THESE GOALS MAY INCLUDE RESULTS CONTINGENT ON REVENUE OR NET INCOME OF THE ARIZONA SPORTS FOUNDATION AND RELATED ORGANIZATIONS. BONUSES ARE APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO PAYMENT.

FOR PAYROLL TAX PURPOSES, THE ARIZONA SPORTS FOUNDATION (ASF) PAYS MOST (SEE BELOW) EMPLOYEES OF ASF AND ITS RELATED ORGANIZATIONS, VALLEY OF THE SUN BOWL FOUNDATION (VSFB), FIESTA EVENTS, INC. (FEI), AND ARIZONA COLLEGE FOOTBALL CHAMPIONSHIP FOUNDATION (ACFCF). ALLOCATIONS OF OFFICER, KEY EMPLOYEE AND STAFF COMPENSATED ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE EMPLOYEES' AVERAGE TIME DEVOTED TO EACH OF THE ORGANIZATIONS. CERTAIN EMPLOYEES OF AZ 2016 COLLEGE FOOTBALL CHAMPIONSHIP LLC, A SINGLE MEMBER LLC WHOLLY OWNED BY THE ARIZONA COLLEGE FOOTBALL CHAMPIONSHIP FOUNDATION (ACFCF), WERE PAID AND REPORTED FOR PAYROLL TAX PURPOSES BY THE LLC AND HAVE BEEN REPORTED ON THE 990 FOR THE ACFCF.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART V, LINE 2B, AND PART IX, COMPENSATION AMOUNTS:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EMPLOYEES DEVOTING TIME TO THE ARIZONA SPORTS FOUNDATION (ASF) AND ITS RELATED AFFILIATES (ARIZONA COLLGE FOOTBALL CHAMPIONSHIP FOUNDATION (ACFCF), FIESTA EVENTS, INC (FEI), AND VALLEY OF THE SUN BOWL FOUNDATION (VSBF)) ARE ALL EMPLOYEES OF ASF FOR PAYROLL TAX PURPOSES. COSTS RELATED TO PERSONNEL ARE SHARED AMONGST ALL AFFILIATED ENTITIES AND ARE REPORTED ON PART IX AS EMPLOYEE RELATED EXPENSES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS DELEGATES BOARD AUTHORITY TO AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE PURPOSE OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL BE TO MAKE ROUTINE BUSINESS DECISIONS FOR AND ON BEHALF OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND THE CORPORATION. ALL MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL BE DIRECTORS. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL NOT BE AUTHORIZED, WITHOUT THE APPROVAL OF A MAJORITY VOTE OF THE DIRECTORS PRESENT, IN PERSON OR BY PROXY, AT A DULY CONVENED MEETING AT WHICH A QUORUM IS PRESENT, TO TAKE ANY ACTIONS THAT REQUIRE THE APPROVAL OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE CORPORATION. THE MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL INCLUDE THE CHAIRMAN, IMMEDIATE PAST CHAIRMAN, CHAIRMAN-ELECT, TREASURER, SECRETARY, THE CHAIRS OF THE NOMINATING AND GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE AND AUDIT & COMPLIANCE COMMITTEE, AND TWO OTHER DIRECTORS NOMINATED BY THE CHAIRMAN AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FROM TIME TO TIME. THE CHAIRMAN SHALL SERVE AS THE CHAIRMAN OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. ALL OTHER ASPECTS OF THE FUNCTION AND PROCEDURES OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL BE DECIDED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, TO THE EXTENT DELEGATED SUCH POWERS BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, MAY AUTHORIZE ANY OFFICER OR AGENT OF THE CORPORATION TO ENTER INTO ANY CONTRACT OR TO EXECUTE AND DELIVER ANY INSTRUMENT IN THE NAME OF AND ON BEHALF OF THE CORPORATION. ADDITIONALLY, CERTAIN MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE ARE AUTHORIZED TO SIGN CHECKS AND AUTHORIZE DEPOSITS OF FUNDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE RETURN IS PREPARED AND REVIEWED BY CLIFTONLARSONALLEN LLP FOLLOWED BY MANAGEMENT'S FINAL REVIEW. ONCE THE RETURN IS COMPLETED AND REVIEWED, THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE AUDIT AND COMPLIANCE COMMITTEE FOR THEIR REVIEW. AFTER THE COMMITTEE REVIEW THE RETURN IS PRESENTED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. UPON REVIEW AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, THE RETURN IS FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION ANNUALLY REQUIRES ALL EMPLOYEES, OFFICERS, AND MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE AND SIGN THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. COPIES OF ALL CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS ARE PROVIDED TO THE AUDIT AND COMPLIANCE COMMITTEE WHO REVIEWS IF CONFLICT HAS BEEN NOTED. PROCEDURES ALSO INCLUDE REVIEWING TRANSACTIONS AGAINST BOTH THE FORMS SUBMITTED AND ALL KNOWN BUSINESS ASSOCIATIONS OF OUR BOARD MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR COMPENSATION PROCESS - *COMPENSATION COMMITTEE DETERMINES COMPENSATION FIGURES *FORM 990 OF COMPARABLE ORGANIZATIONS INCLUDED IN COMPENSATION *EXCUTIVE DIRECTOR ENGAGED UNDER A WRITTEN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT *ORGANIZATION PARTICIPATES ANNUALLY IN THE FOOTBALL BOWL ASSOCIATION SURVEY *COMPENSATION APPROVED ANNUALLY BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AFTER A RECOMMENDATION BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. WE BELIEVE THESE ACTIONS CREATE A REBUTTABLE PRESUMPTION OF REASONABLE COMPENSATION. KEY EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION PROCESS - *EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR REVIEWS PERFORMANCE AND DETERMINES COMPENSATION *COMPENSATION AMOUNT TO BOARD OF DIRECTOR CHAIR FOR APPROVAL *COMPENSATION IS COMPARED TO 990S OF OTHER COMPARABLE ORGANIZATIONS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES PUBLIC ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, INCLUDING ITS BY-LAWS AND 501(C)(3) DETERMINATION LETTER, AS WELL AS KEY POLICIES SUCH AS THE CODE OF CONDUCT, CODE OF ETHICS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST, EXPENSE REIMBURSEMENT, POLITICAL ACTIVITY, RECORD RETENTION AND DESTRUCTION, TICKET POLICY AND WHISTLEBLOWER PROTECTION. ALL DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC VIEWING AT HTTPS://FIESTABOWL.ORG/WHO-WE-ARE/GOVERNANCE/. THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT MAKES ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.

ASF, VSBF, FEI, AND THE ACFCF HAVE A COMMON BOARD OF DIRECTORS. A BOARD MEMBER IS CONSIDERED INDEPENDENT IF THEY RECEIVE NO COMPENSATION AS AN EMPLOYEE AND HAVE NO REPORTABLE TRANSACTIONS ON SCHEDULE L IN A CAPACITY OTHER THAN AS A BOARD MEMBER. IF A BOARD MEMEBER IS CONSIDERED NOT INDEPENDENT FOR ONE ORGANIZATION, THEY ARE CONSIDERED NOT INDEPENDENT FOR ALL RELATED ORGANIZATIONS. AMONG THE FOUR RELATED ORGANIZATIONS, THERE WERE NO TRANSACTIONS TO REPORT. UNDER THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OF THE ORGANIZATION, BOARD MEMBERS MUST RECUSE THEMSELVES FROM THE DISCUSSION AND VOTE OF ANY RELATED TRANSACTION.
THE OVERSIGHT AND SELECTION PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED SINCE THE PRIOR YEAR.
